title: New Zealand are the greatest sporting team in history but we can beat them, insists Eddie Jones
text:
Eddie Jones set the scene for an epic World Cup semi-final by saying that the All Blacks are the greatest sporting team in history — and England can beat them.

Under Jones, England have reached the last four for the first time in 12 years, as New Zealand are seeking the global title for a third successive time.

Jones dismissed any sense that the favourites are invincible. ‘New Zealand are a great team with a great coach and a great captain,’ Jones said, ‘but, like any team, they are beatable.

Eddie Jones believes England can beat New Zealand in the two nations' World Cup semi-final

‘There are ways to beat them and we will be investigating every possible way of how we beat them this week.’

Jones is fond of a cricket reference and once again he mentioned Australia’s Ashes batting hero: ‘If you’re bowling against Steve Smith, or you’re bowing against Joe Root when he’s in form, you’ve got to be respectful of their ability. But there’s a way to get them out.

Good bowlers are able to work them out, not go away from the plan, keep digging away.

‘But what happens is that people get bored and they try to find the magic solution and that magic solution allows that batsman to get free.

‘But if you keep them where they don’t like to be for long enough, you’ll get a result. It’s the same in rugby.’

The All Blacks haven't suffered defeat in a World Cup match since France beat them in 2007

The All Blacks haven’t lost a World Cup match since France shocked them in a quarter-final in Cardiff in 2007.

Jones said: ‘We have a challenge this week because we are playing the greatest team that has ever been in sport. I don’t think there’s a team that comes close to them for sustainability.

'Since the last World Cup, I think they’ve won nearly 90 per cent of their Tests. Name me another team in the world that plays at the absolute top level that wins 90 per cent of their games.

‘I just admire them. To do what they do from a small country is incredible. It’s an example of what you can do. People are raving about Japan at the moment and it’s fantastic, but you look at what New Zealand have done with four million people. They produce this rugby team that has a 90 per cent winning record. You have to admire them.

Jones believes that Ireland were the latest team to fall under the All Black's spell on Saturday

‘But then the challenge is to beat them. You always want to play the best and they are the best. If you want to be the best in the world, you have to beat the best. For the players and coaches, this is the best week of their lives and you have to enjoy it and work to get better.’

Jones suggested that Ireland became the latest team to fall under the All Blacks’ spell before their quarter-final had even begun.

‘I think what happens is you become part of the show,’ he said. ‘I thought that happened a bit on Sunday. Ireland really got stuck in when the game was lost. You have to go hard from the start. That’s going to be important for us.’

And Jones was not indulging in euphoria. ‘All we’ve earned on Saturday is another week in the competition,’ said Jones. ‘There’s nothing to celebrate.’
description: CHRIS FOY IN OITA: Eddie Jones set the scene for an epic World Cup semi-final by saying that the All Blacks are the greatest sporting team in history - and England can beat them.
authors: Chris Foy For The Daily Mail
